appFrameworks.question: AppKit
appFrameworks.answer: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your macOS app.

appFrameworks.question: Bundle Resources
appFrameworks.answer: Resources located in an app, framework, or plugin bundle.

appFrameworks.question: Foundation
appFrameworks.answer: Access essential data types, collections, and operating-system services to define the base layer of functionality for your app.

appFrameworks.question: Swift
appFrameworks.answer: Build apps using a powerful open language.

appFrameworks.question: SwiftUI
appFrameworks.answer: Declare the user interface and behavior for your app on every platform.

appFrameworks.question: TVML
appFrameworks.answer: Use Apple TV Markup Language to create individual pages inside of a client-server app.

appFrameworks.question: TVMLKit
appFrameworks.answer: Create client-server apps by incorporating JavaScript and TVML files in your binary app.

appFrameworks.question: TVMLKit JS
appFrameworks.answer: Create tvOS client-server apps using web technologies to stream media and respond to events.

appFrameworks.question: TVUIKit
appFrameworks.answer: Show common user interface elements from Apple TV in your native app.

appFrameworks.question: UIKit
appFrameworks.answer: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS or tvOS app.

appFrameworks.question: WatchKit
appFrameworks.answer: Build apps that leverage watchOS features like background tasks, extended runtime sessions, and access to the Digital Crown.

appServices.question: Accounts
appServices.answer: Help users access and manage their external accounts from within your app, without requiring them to enter login credentials.

appServices.question: AddressBook
appServices.answer: Access the centralized database for storing users’ contacts.

appServices.question: AddressBookUI
appServices.answer: Access users’ contacts and display them in a graphical interface.

appServices.question: AdSupport
appServices.answer: Provide apps with access to an advertising identifier and a flag indicating whether a device is using limited ad tracking.

appServices.question: App Store Receipts
appServices.answer: Validate app and in-app purchase receipts with the App Store.

appServices.question: App Store Server Notifications
appServices.answer: Monitor subscription events in real time with server notifications from the App Store.

appServices.question: ApplicationServices
appServices.answer: Perform common application tasks.

appServices.question: AutomaticAssessmentConfiguration
appServices.answer: Prevent users from accessing specific system features during high-stakes assessment activities, such as administering an exam.

appServices.question: BackgroundTasks
appServices.answer: Request the system to launch your app in the background to run tasks.

appServices.question: Business Chat
appServices.answer: Chat with your customers using the Messages app.

appServices.question: Business Chat REST API
appServices.answer: Support your clients and their customers by integrating your messaging platform with the Business Chat service.

appServices.question: CallKit
appServices.answer: Display the system-calling UI for your app’s VoIP services, and coordinate your calling services with other apps and the system.

appServices.question: CareKit
appServices.answer: Create apps that help people better understand and manage their health.

appServices.question: CarPlay
appServices.answer: Add CarPlay support to your navigation app.

appServices.question: ClassKit
appServices.answer: Enable teachers to assign activities from your app’s content and to view student progress.

appServices.question: ClockKit
appServices.answer: Display app-specific data in the complications on the clock face.

appServices.question: CloudKit
appServices.answer: Store structured app and user data in iCloud containers that can be shared by all users of your app.

appServices.question: Combine
appServices.answer: Customize handling of asynchronous events by combining event-processing operators.

appServices.question: Contacts
appServices.answer: Access the user's contacts and format and localize contact information.

appServices.question: ContactsUI
appServices.answer: Display information about users’ contacts in a graphical interface.

appServices.question: Core Data
appServices.answer: Persist or cache data and support undo on a single device.

appServices.question: Core Foundation
appServices.answer: Access low-level functions, primitive data types, and various collection types that are bridged seamlessly with the Foundation framework.

appServices.question: Core Location
appServices.answer: Obtain the geographic location and orientation of a device.

appServices.question: Core ML
appServices.answer: Integrate machine learning models into your app.

appServices.question: Core Motion
appServices.answer: Process accelerometer, gyroscope, pedometer, and environment-related events.

appServices.question: Core Spotlight
appServices.answer: Index your app so users can search the content from Spotlight and Safari.

appServices.question: Core Text
appServices.answer: Create text layouts, optimize font handling, and access font metrics and glyph data.

appServices.question: Create ML
appServices.answer: Create machine learning models for use in your app.

appServices.question: DeviceCheck
appServices.answer: Access per-device, per-developer data that your associated server can use in its business logic.

appServices.question: EventKit
appServices.answer: Create, view, and edit calendar and reminder events.

appServices.question: EventKitUI
appServices.answer: Display an interface for viewing, selecting, and editing calendar events and reminders.

appServices.question: FileProvider
appServices.answer: Implement a File Provider extension so that other apps can access the documents and directories stored and managed by your containing app.

appServices.question: FileProviderUI
appServices.answer: Add actions to the document browser's context menu.

appServices.question: HealthKit
appServices.answer: Access and share health and fitness data while maintaining the user’s privacy and control.

appServices.question: HomeKit
appServices.answer: Communicate with, configure, and control home automation accessories.

appServices.question: iAd
appServices.answer: Track and attribute app downloads that originate from Apple Search Ads campaigns.

appServices.question: JavaScriptCore
appServices.answer: Evaluate JavaScript programs from within an app, and support JavaScript scripting of your app.

appServices.question: MapKit
appServices.answer: Display map or satellite imagery from your app's interface, call out points of interest, and determine placemark information for map coordinates.

appServices.question: Messages
appServices.answer: Create app extensions that allow users to send text, stickers, media files, and interactive messages.

appServices.question: MessageUI
appServices.answer: Create a user interface for composing email and text messages, so users can edit and send messages without leaving your app.

appServices.question: MultipeerConnectivity
appServices.answer: Support peer-to-peer connectivity and the discovery of nearby devices.

appServices.question: Natural Language
appServices.answer: Analyze natural language text and deduce its language-specific metadata.

appServices.question: NewsstandKit
appServices.answer: Browse and download newspaper and magazine assets in the background.

appServices.question: NotificationCenter
appServices.answer: Create and manage widgets for the Today view.

appServices.question: PassKit (Apple Pay and Wallet)
appServices.answer: Request and process Apple Pay payments in your app. Create, distribute, and update passes for the Wallet app.

appServices.question: PreferencePanes
appServices.answer: Integrate your app's custom preferences into the System Preferences app.

appServices.question: PushKit
appServices.answer: Respond to push notifications related to your app’s complications, file providers, and VoIP services.

appServices.question: QuickLook
appServices.answer: Create previews of files to use inside your app, or perform simple edits on previews.

appServices.question: QuickLookThumbnailing
appServices.answer: Generate thumbnails for common file types and add a Thumbnail Extension to your app to enable others to create thumbnails of your custom files.

appServices.question: SafariServices
appServices.answer: Enable web views and services in your app.

appServices.question: SiriKit
appServices.answer: Handle user requests for your app’s services that originate from Siri or Maps.

appServices.question: SMS and Call Reporting
appServices.answer: SMS and Call Reporting provides extensions to manage unwanted communication.

appServices.question: Social
appServices.answer: Post content to supported social networking services, using standard system interfaces.

appServices.question: Speech
appServices.answer: Perform speech recognition on live or prerecorded audio, receive transcriptions, alternative interpretations, and confidence levels of the results.

appServices.question: StoreKit
appServices.answer: Support in-app purchases and interactions with the App Store.

appServices.question: TVServices
appServices.answer: Help users discover your app by providing top shelf content and a description of your tvOS app.

appServices.question: UserNotifications
appServices.answer: Push user-facing notifications to the user's device from a server, or generate them locally from your app.

appServices.question: UserNotificationsUI
appServices.answer: Customize the interface that displays local and remote notifications.

appServices.question: Wallet Passes
appServices.answer: GET POST DELETE various wallet and device information

appServices.question: WatchConnectivity
appServices.answer: Implement two-way communication between an iOS app and its paired watchOS app.

appServices.question: WebKit
appServices.answer: Display web content in windows. Implement browser features such as following user-activated links, managing a back-forward list, and managing a history of recently visited pages.

developerTools.question: Automator
developerTools.answer: Develop actions that can be loaded and run by the Automator app. View, edit, and run Automator workflows in your app.

developerTools.question: Code Diagnostics
developerTools.answer: Enable runtime checks to detect and avoid bugs in your code.

developerTools.question: InstallerJS
developerTools.answer: Manage and customize the installation and distribution experience.

developerTools.question: Playground Support
developerTools.answer: Share playground data, manage live views, and control the execution of a playground.

developerTools.question: PlaygroundBluetooth
developerTools.answer: Display and manage connections to Bluetooth peripherals in Swift Playgrounds.

developerTools.question: ScriptingBridge
developerTools.answer: Automate scriptable apps by sending and receiving Apple events.

developerTools.question: Swift Packages
developerTools.answer: Create reusable code, organize it in a lightweight way, and share it across Xcode projects and with other developers.

developerTools.question: Swift Playgrounds
developerTools.answer: Create interactive learning experiences for the Swift Playgrounds app.

developerTools.question: Xcode
developerTools.answer: Build, test, and submit your app with Apple's integrated development environment.

developerTools.question: XcodeKit
developerTools.answer: Create extensions to add commands to the Xcode source editor.

developerTools.question: xcselect
developerTools.answer: A function that finds the path to a macOS SDK version on disk.

developerTools.question: XCTest
developerTools.answer: Create and run unit tests, performance tests, and UI tests for your Xcode project.

graphicsAndGames.question: AGL
graphicsAndGames.answer: Create and manage OpenGL rendering contexts for use in macOS, and perform operations on drawable objects.

graphicsAndGames.question: ARKit
graphicsAndGames.answer: Integrate iOS device camera and motion features to produce augmented reality experiences in your app or game.

graphicsAndGames.question: Core Animation
graphicsAndGames.answer: Render, compose, and animate visual elements.

graphicsAndGames.question: Core Graphics
graphicsAndGames.answer: Harness the power of Quartz technology to perform lightweight 2D rendering with high-fidelity output. Handle path-based drawing, antialiased rendering, gradients, images, color management, PDF documents, and more.

graphicsAndGames.question: Core Image
graphicsAndGames.answer: Use built-in or custom filters to process still and video images.

graphicsAndGames.question: Game Controller
graphicsAndGames.answer: Support hardware game controllers in your game.

graphicsAndGames.question: GameKit
graphicsAndGames.answer: Create experiences that keep players coming back to your game. Add leaderboards, achievements, matchmaking, challenges, and more.

graphicsAndGames.question: GameplayKit
graphicsAndGames.answer: Architect and organize your game logic. Incorporate common gameplay behaviors such as random number generation, artificial intelligence, pathfinding, and agent behavior.

graphicsAndGames.question: GLKit
graphicsAndGames.answer: Speed up OpenGL ES or OpenGL app development. Use math libraries, background texture loading, pre-created shader effects, and a standard view and view controller to implement your rendering loop.

graphicsAndGames.question: Image I/O
graphicsAndGames.answer: Read and write most image file formats. Manage color and access image metadata.

graphicsAndGames.question: Metal
graphicsAndGames.answer: Render advanced 3D graphics and perform data-parallel computations using graphics processors.

graphicsAndGames.question: Metal Performance Shaders
graphicsAndGames.answer: Optimize graphics and compute performance with kernels that are fine-tuned for the unique characteristics of each Metal GPU family.

graphicsAndGames.question: MetalKit
graphicsAndGames.answer: Build Metal apps quicker and easier, using far less code. Render graphics in a standard Metal view, load textures from many sources, and work efficiently with models provided by Model I/O.

graphicsAndGames.question: Model I/O
graphicsAndGames.answer: Import, export, and manipulate 3D models using a common infrastructure that integrates MetalKit, GLKit, and SceneKit.

graphicsAndGames.question: OpenGL ES
graphicsAndGames.answer: Create 3D and 2D graphics effects with this compact, efficient subset of OpenGL.

graphicsAndGames.question: PDFKit
graphicsAndGames.answer: Display and manipulate PDF documents in your applications.

graphicsAndGames.question: PencilKit
graphicsAndGames.answer: Capture touch input as an opaque drawing and display that content from your app.

graphicsAndGames.question: Quartz
graphicsAndGames.answer: Allow users to browse, edit, and save images, using slideshows and Core Image filters.

graphicsAndGames.question: RealityKit
graphicsAndGames.answer: Simulate and render 3D content for use in your augmented reality apps.

graphicsAndGames.question: ReplayKit
graphicsAndGames.answer: Record or stream video from the screen, and audio from the app and microphone.

graphicsAndGames.question: SceneKit
graphicsAndGames.answer: Create 3D games and add 3D content to apps using high-level scene descriptions. Easily add animations, physics simulation, particle effects, and realistic physically based rendering.

graphicsAndGames.question: SpriteKit
graphicsAndGames.answer: Add high-performance 2D content with smooth animations to your app, or create a game with a high-level set of 2D game-based tools.

graphicsAndGames.question: Vision
graphicsAndGames.answer: Apply computer vision algorithms to perform a variety of tasks on input images and video.

media.question: Apple News
media.answer: Design, create, and publish signature content for Apple News.

media.question: Apple Search Ads
media.answer: Drive app discovery by creating and managing campaigns with the Apple Search Ads Campaign Management API.

media.question: AssetsLibrary
media.answer: Access the assets in a user’s media library.

media.question: AudioToolbox
media.answer: Record or play audio, convert formats, parse audio streams, and configure your audio session.

media.question: AudioUnit
media.answer: Add sophisticated audio manipulation and processing capabilities to your app. Create audio unit extensions that generate or modify audio in a host app.

media.question: AVFoundation
media.answer: Work with audiovisual assets, control device cameras, process audio, and configure system audio interactions.

media.question: AVKit
media.answer: Create view-level services for media playback, complete with user controls, chapter navigation, and support for subtitles and closed captioning.

media.question: Core Audio
media.answer: Use the Core Audio framework to interact with device’s audio hardware.

media.question: Core Audio Kit
media.answer: Add user interfaces to audio units.

media.question: Core Audio Types
media.answer: Use specialized data types to interact with audio streams, complex buffers, and audiovisual timestamps.

media.question: Core Haptics
media.answer: Compose and play haptic patterns to customize your iOS app's haptic feedback.

media.question: Core Media
media.answer: Represent time-based audio-visual assets with essential data types.

media.question: Core MIDI
media.answer: Communicate with MIDI devices such as hardware keyboards and synthesizers.

media.question: Core Video
media.answer: Process digital video—including manipulation of individual frames—using a pipeline-based API and support for both Metal and OpenGL.

media.question: HTTP Live Streaming
media.answer: Send audio and video to iOS, tvOS, and macOS devices.

media.question: ImageCaptureCore
media.answer: ImageCaptureCore enables your app to browse for media devices and control them programatically.

media.question: iTunesLibrary
media.answer: Retrieve the properties of the media in the user’s iTunes library.

media.question: Media Player
media.answer: Find and play songs, audio podcasts, audio books, and more from within your app.

media.question: MediaAccessibility
media.answer: Coordinate the presentation of closed-captioned data for your app's media files.

media.question: MediaLibrary
media.answer: Access read-only collections of the user’s multimedia content.

media.question: PhotoKit
media.answer: Work with image and video assets managed by the Photos app, including those from iCloud Photos and Live Photos.

media.question: Professional Video Applications
media.answer: Exchange data with Final Cut Pro X, and create effects plug-ins for Final Cut Pro and Motion.

media.question: QTKit
media.answer: Perform basic manipulation of media such as movie playback and editing. Import and export standard media formats.

media.question: ScreenSaver
media.answer: Animate screen savers, and interact with the screen saver infrastructure. Use functions that help you produce random values and centering rectangles.

media.question: SoundAnalysis
media.answer: Analyze streamed and file-based audio to classify it as a particular type.

media.question: VideoToolbox
media.answer: Work directly with hardware-accelerated video encoding and decoding capabilities.

media.question: VisionKit
media.answer: Use the iOS camera to scan documents like those you capture in the Notes app.

system.question: Accelerate
system.answer: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low-energy consumption.

system.question: Apple CryptoKit
system.answer: Perform cryptographic operations securely and efficiently.

system.question: AuthenticationServices
system.answer: Make it easy for users to log into apps and services.

system.question: CFNetwork
system.answer: Access network services and handle changes in network configurations. Build on abstractions of network protocols to simplify tasks such as working with BSD sockets, administering HTTP and FTP servers, and managing Bonjour services.

system.question: Collaboration
system.answer: Find and access identities, that is, users and groups. Display the Identity Picker, which lets users create and select identities.

system.question: Compression
system.answer: Leverage common compression algorithms for lossless data compression.

system.question: Core Bluetooth
system.answer: Communicate with Bluetooth low energy and BR/EDR (“Classic”) Devices.

system.question: Core NFC
system.answer: Detect NFC tags, read messages that contain NDEF data, and save data to writable tags.

system.question: Core Services
system.answer: Access and manage key operating system services, such as launch and identity services.

system.question: Core Telephony
system.answer: Access information about a user’s cellular service provider, such as its unique identifier and whether the carrier allows VoIP.

system.question: Core WLAN
system.answer: Query AirPort interfaces and choose wireless networks.

system.question: CryptoTokenKit
system.answer: Access security tokens and the cryptographic assets they store.

system.question: DarwinNotify
system.answer: Send and receive Darwin notifications.

system.question: Device Management
system.answer: Manage your organization's devices remotely.

system.question: DiskArbitration
system.answer: Provides mechanisms for registering for mount/unmount notification and blocking mount/unmount events.

system.question: Dispatch
system.answer: Execute code concurrently on multicore hardware by submitting work to dispatch queues managed by the system.

system.question: dnssd
system.answer: Discover, publish, and resolve network services on a local area or wide area network.

system.question: DriverKit
system.answer: Develop device drivers that run in user space.

system.question: EndpointSecurity
system.answer: Develop system extensions that enhance user security.

system.question: ExceptionHandling
system.answer: Monitor and debug exceptional conditions in code.

system.question: ExternalAccessory
system.answer: Communicate with accessories connected to a device by the Apple Lightning connector, or connected wirelessly through Bluetooth.

system.question: FinderSync
system.answer: Enhance the Finder’s user interface by adding badges, shortcut menu items, and toolbar buttons.

system.question: ForceFeedback
system.answer: Control force feedback devices attached to the system. Develop plug-ins that enable communication with force feedback hardware.

system.question: FWAUserLib
system.answer: Interface with FireWire audio devices to manage connections, audio engines, and audio and MIDI streams.

system.question: GSS
system.answer: Conduct secure, authenticated network transactions.

system.question: HIDDriverKit
system.answer: Develop drivers for human-interface devices, such as keyboards, pointing devices, and digitizers like pens and touch pads.

system.question: Hypervisor
system.answer: Build virtualization solutions on top of a lightweight hypervisor, without the need for third-party kernel extensions.

system.question: InputMethodKit
system.answer: Develop input methods and manage communication with client applications, candidates windows, and input method modes.

system.question: IOBluetooth
system.answer: Gain user-space access to Bluetooth devices.

system.question: IOBluetoothUI
system.answer: Present an interface through which users can pair their devices with other Bluetooth devices.

system.question: IOKit
system.answer: Gain user-space access to hardware devices and drivers.

system.question: IOSurface
system.answer: Share hardware-accelerated buffer data (framebuffers and textures) across multiple processes. Manage image memory more efficiently.

system.question: IOUSBHost
system.answer: Find and access identities, that is, users and groups. Display the Identity Picker, which lets users create and select identities.

system.question: Kernel
system.answer: Develop kernel-resident device drivers and kernel extensions.

system.question: LatentSemanticMapping
system.answer: The Latent Semantic Mapping framework supports the classification of text and other token-based content into developer-defined categories.

system.question: Local Authentication
system.answer: Authenticate users biometrically or with a passphrase they already know.

system.question: MetricKit
system.answer: Aggregate and analyze per-device reports on power and performance metrics.

system.question: MobileCoreServices
system.answer: Use uniform type identifier (UTI) information to create and manipulate data that can be exchanged between your app and other apps and services.

system.question: Network
system.answer: Create network connections to send and receive data using transport and security protocols.

system.question: NetworkExtension
system.answer: Customize and extend core networking features.

system.question: NetworkingDriverKit
system.answer: Develop drivers for Ethernet networking devices.

system.question: Objective-C Runtime
system.answer: Gain low-level access to the Objective-C runtime and the Objective-C root types.

system.question: OpenDirectory
system.answer: Authenticate users, and search for contact information in Open Directory and LDAP directories.

system.question: os
system.answer: Initiate activity tracing and unified logging operations that make problem diagnosis easier when debugging.

system.question: OSLog
system.answer: A unified logging system for the reading of historical data.

system.question: PCIDriverKit
system.answer: Develop device drivers for Peripheral Component Interconnect (PCI) accessories.

system.question: Security
system.answer: Secure the data your app manages, and control access to your app.

system.question: SecurityFoundation
system.answer: Restrict a user’s access to particular features in your Mac app or daemon.

system.question: SecurityInterface
system.answer: Provide user interface elements for security features such as authorization, access to digital certificates, and access to items in keychains.

system.question: SerialDriverKit
system.answer: Develop drivers for serial I/O devices connected to your Mac.

system.question: ServiceManagement
system.answer: Load and unload launchd services. Read and modify launchd dictionaries from within an app.

system.question: simd
system.answer: Instruction set for processing multiple elements that perform the same operation on multiple data points simultaneously.

system.question: SystemConfiguration
system.answer: Allow applications to access a device’s network configuration settings. Determine the reachability of the device, such as whether Wi-Fi or cell connectivity are active.

system.question: SystemExtensions
system.answer: Install and manage user space code that extends the capabilities of macOS.

system.question: USBDriverKit
system.answer: Develop drivers for USB-based devices.

system.question: USBSerialDriverKit
system.answer: Develop drivers for serial IO devices connected to your Mac.

system.question: vmnet
system.answer: Connect with network interfaces to read and write packets on guest operating systems.

system.question: XPC
system.answer: Access a low-level (libSystem) interprocess communication mechanism that is based on serialized property lists.

web.question: App Store Connect API
web.answer: Automate tasks on the Apple Developer website and App Store Connect.

web.question: Apple Music API
web.answer: Integrate streaming music with Apple Music content.

web.question: Apple Pay on the Web
web.answer: Support Apple Pay on your website with JavaScript-based APIs.

web.question: CloudKit JS
web.answer: Provide access from your web app to your CloudKit app’s containers and databases.

web.question: LinkPresentation
web.answer: Fetch, provide, and present rich links in your app.

web.question: LivePhotosKit JS
web.answer: Play Live Photos on the web.

web.question: MapKit JS
web.answer: Embed interactive Apple maps on your website, annotate points of interest, and perform geo-related searches.

web.question: Maps Web Snapshots
web.answer: Create a static image of a map from a URL.

web.question: MusicKit JS
web.answer: Add an Apple Music player to your web app.

web.question: Safari Extensions JS
web.answer: Extend the browsing experience with injected scripts and style sheets for web content, custom buttons in the Safari toolbar, and contextual menu items.

web.question: Sign in with Apple
web.answer: Provide users the ability to sign in to your apps and websites using their Apple ID.

web.question: Sign in with Apple REST API
web.answer: Communicate between your app servers and Apple’s authentication servers.

web.question: WebKit JS
web.answer: Access and modify DOM elements within a webpage, including touch events and visual effects.
